1647.name: Third Level of Eastern Tower
description: You are in the center of the Eastern Tower's third floor.  The room you are in
glows with a mysterious light that has no source.  In the center of the room a
ladder climbs up to a hatchway in the ceiling.  The hatchway is a strange
looking keyhole.  There is also a door to the west.
The hatchway appears securely fastened.  In it is a strange keyhole.

1716.name: Entrance to a Large Hut
description: You are in the entry foyer of a large hut.  A curtain separates this section
of the hut from the next section to the west.  To the east is an opening out
onto the clearing.
There is a curtain here separating this section from the next.
The opening leads out onto the clearing.

1709.name: Path to Centaur Village
description: You are on an east-west path in the forest.  Here the forest is mostly
towering firs, not quite as dense as the oak groves that can be seen eastward.
Westward, the trail heads toward a small clearing.
There is a small clearing in this direction.

1604.name: West Side of Moat
description: You stand on the west side of a moat that encircles two towers, each
over 50 feet high. You will need a boat to go east across the moat. A
rugged path heads west, and another one heads north to a cluster of low
buildings.
A worn path leads to a cluster of low buildings.
An old ill-kept roads leads away to the west.
The Towers loom directly over you, just beyond the moat.

1643.name: Third Level of Western Tower
description: You stand in the center of the western tower's third floor.  This large room
glows mysteriously with a strange light all its own.  From a door to the east
comes a strange inky blackness.  A spiral staircase leads down.

1632.name: Common Room
description: You are in what must once have been a common room for all residents of the
tower. There is a huge fire pit with a chimney in the center, and the smashed
remains of a great many table and chairs.  The exit is south.
You notice a grate in the bottom of the fire pit.  Maybe it's an opening ...

1705.name: Trail south of forest
description: You are on a primitive north-south trail.  Just north of here looms the
entrance to a deep, dark forest. To the south the trail continues.
The trail enters a dark forest of thick oaks this way.
The trail continues.

1638.name: Shaman's Room
description: You have entered an elegantly furnished room that looks to be still in use!
Costly paintings and pieces of furniture are tastefully situated.  On the
north wall is an altar to Knar, the ghastly patron of Gargoyles.  The only
exit is south.

1714.name: Centaur's Hut
description: You are inside a smallish hut, the home of a family of Centaurs.  The hut
is sparsely furnished, mostly the trappings of survival.
The opening leads out onto the clearing.

1628.name: Conservatory
description: You are in the tower's private conservatory. However, through years of neglect,
the plants have grown into a hideous jungle.  The only exit is north.

1640.name: Second Level of the Western Tower
description: You are in the center of the western tower's second floor.  A large spiral
staircase of 29 steps connects this level with the third.  There are doors
to the east and west.  Except for a torch bracket in each corner, the
room is barren.
You see the spiral staircase leading up.

1706.name: Entrance to the forest
description: You are at the entrance to dark forest comprised mostly of huge
black oak and towering firs.  A trail from the south continues north
on into the woods at this point.  A small clearing lies to the east.
You see the trail head back on south.

1645.name: Armory
description: In this room, which has somehow evaded the ravages of time, are neatly stored
racks of common weapons.  They appear to be quite ordinary; however, a chest
in one corner catches your eye.  The only exit is the way you came in.

1636.name: Second Level of the Eastern Tower
description: You are in the center of the second level of the Eastern tower. This large
room appears quite empty, except for the candle abras firmly fixed to the
walls.  An opening leads westward, and a spiral staircase leads down.

1624.name: Grand Lobby
description: You have entered a vast lobby. This lobby appears to have once been very
ornately furnished, but now everything is decayed and moldering.  A highly
ornate balcony surrounds the lobby. To the east, below the balcony, is an
opening. The door leading out is west.  You notice that the balcony is
covered in highly ornate and life-like stone gargoyles.

1609.name: Empty Room
description: This room appears to be completely empty. The only exit seems to be the
way you came.  There are some scratches around the floor.
You see a concealed opening leading down.

1626.name: Musty Corridor
description: You are walking along a musty east-west corridor joining the two towers.
There are room on each side of the corridor, and openings at each end.

1620.name: Western Moat
description: You are in the middle of the moat, on the west side of the tower.  There is a
landing on both sides of the moat.  Deep throated 'ribbids' come from the
water all around you.

1639.name: Library
description: This room appears to have been a library.  Empty book shelves line each wall.
The only exit is north.

1608.name: Old Store Room
description: You have entered what appears to be an old storeroom. Most of the items
that were in here appear to have been ruined long ago.

1651.name: On the Other Side
description: You are outdoors on a catwalk between the turrets of the Eastern and Western
towers.  There is no opening into the western tower of any kind.  You have a
fabulous view of your surroundings, a murky city partially obscured by strange
smoke that creeps along the ground instead of rising. The city stretches as far
as the eye can see under the conditions.

1602.name: Rough Path Between the Hills
description: Here the path passes between low hills. The going is very rough, but
to the east the ground is smoother. In that direction a pair of tower
looms above the hills.
The road continues.
You see a pair of tall towers in the distance.

1633.name: Servant's Quarters
description: You are in what once was the servant's quarters, as evidenced by the shabby
belongings and decor. What little remains is rotting and of little value
anyway.  The only exit is north.

1702.name: Crossroads to the Wilderness
description: You are at a crossroads to the wilderness areas east and north of here,
and the more civilized areas to the west. The main road is west, an
older road continues east, and a simple trail heads north.  To the south,
an old ram-shackle building is being used as a trading post for the
surrounding wilderness.
An old, ram-shackle building serves as a trading post here.
You see a trail leading north.
The old Eastern road continues this way.

1649.name: On the Catwalk
description: You are outdoors on a catwalk between the turrets of the eastern and
western towers.  There is a 40 foot drop to the north and south.  You have
a fabulous view of the surrounding countryside, which consists of a bleak
wilderness.  At the east end of the catwalk is a small opening leading
inside the eastern turret.  At the western end, a strange mirror-like portal
leads into the western turret.
A mirror-like portal glimmers, allowing entry into the western turret.

1623.name: Tower Foyer
description: You are on a foyer on the west side of the structure. The moat is west of
here. There is also a large door eastward into the structure.  You notice that
the walls are ornately decorated with very life-like stone gargoyles.

1703.name: Trading Post
description: You are in a trading post just south of the crossroads, where rangers,
trappers and hunters from the surrounding area come to buy, sell, and
barter goods.
The door opens out on the crossroads.

1603.name: Path through an Open Area
description: You are on a path through an open area. East of here loom two tall towers,
joined by a barbican and surrounded by a murky moat. West the path passes
between low hills.
The road continues.
Two fantastic towers surrounded by a moat rise before you.

1635.name: On the First Staircase
description: You are on a Spiral staircase connecting the first and second levels of
the eastern tower. You can go up or down.

1704.name: Trail north of crossroads
description: You are on a primitive north-south trail. South of here is a major cross-
roads and an old building. To the north the trail continues toward a
deep, dark forest.
The trail continues toward a deep, dark, forest.
A major crossroads and a building lie in this direction.

1642.name: Spiral Stairs
description: You are on a large spiral staircase of 29 steps, leading between the
second and third floors.  You can go up or down.

1631.name: Base of the Eastern Tower
description: You stand in the center of the Eastern tower's base. Torch brackets occupy the
four corners of this huge room.  Above each torch is a lifelike ornate stone
gargoyle.  There are are open doors to the north and south, and passages east
and west.  In addition, a spiral staircase leads up to the next level of this
tower.
You see a spiral staircase leading up.

1634.name: Large Murky Cellar
description: You are in a large, murky cellar. An almost tangible air of horror pervades
the room.  A thin layer of nitre covers the walls and ceiling.  Rotting
furniture looms obliquely about the room.

1641.name: On the Balcony
description: You are on the balcony overlooking the Grand lobby.  You have a fabulous
view of the entire room.  The only exit is the way you came in.

1614.name: Base of the Northern Tower
description: You stand within the partially enclosed stairwell of the northern
part of Wyvern Tower.  The tower itself forks out into several smaller
structures as it rises up into the sky.  The wall south seems to be an
illusion of some sort.

1606.name: Cluster of Buildings
description: You are in the middle of a cluster of small buildings. There is a building
to the north, east, and west.  A sign over the eastern building says
'House of Pancakes'.
A path heads south toward the west side of the towers.
There is an entrance to a building.
There is an entrance to a building here.
A sign over the door reads 'House of Pancakes'.

1715.name: Centaur's Hut
description: You are inside a smallish hut, the home of a family of Centaurs.  The hut
is sparsely furnished, mostly the trappings of survival.
The opening leads out onto the clearing.

1708.name: Trail in Dark Oak Forest
description: The trail here passes through groves of closely knit Black Oak.
Some of these trees are of enormous size.  Rustling and other low
noises come from the forest on either side of the trail.  The forest
trail veers to the west here.  A seemingly abandoned house lies to the
north.

1611.name: Boondocks Courier Checkpoint
description: You are within the Boondocks Courier Checkpoint.  To the north is
Wyvern's Tower, and to the south is a hard-packed area set within the
marsh, for airship parking.

1601.name: Rough East-West Path
description: You are on a very rough and overgrown path heading east-west over rugged
terrain.  To the east the path passes between low hills.
The cross-roads and a trading post lie in this direction.
The road heads into low hills this way.

1717.name: Back of a Large Hut
description: You are in the back of a large hut.  A curtain separates this section from
the front of the hut to the east.  This room is finely decorated, if
somewhat primitive.  The decor suggests someone of authority lives here.
There is a curtain here separating this room from the front of the hut.

1644.name: It's too dark to see anything!

1713.name: Centaur's Hut
description: You are inside a smallish hut, the home of a family of Centaurs.  The hut
is sparsely furnished, mostly the trappings of survival.
The opening leads out onto the clearing.

1710.name: East side of the Centaur Clearing
description: You are on the east side of a clearing.  Small primitive huts are scattered
about the edges of this clearing.  Beyond these on all sides are towering
fir trees.  A path leads east out of the clearing. The clearing continues to
the west.
There is a hut here.
There is a hut here.
You see the west side of the clearing.
A path leads away through the forest.

1605.name: Path North of Moat
description: You walk on a faint path heading south toward the west side of the moat,
and north to three small buildings.
Several low buildings lie this way.
The path ends west of the moat.

1646.name: Officer's Quarters
description: You have entered a lavish but functional room decked out in a military style.
Murals on the wall show battle scenes in gargoyles, minotaurs, and huge,
flying snake-like reptiles with poisonous tails fight humans and dwarves.
Various objects in the room give evidence that it is occupied by individuals
of authority.  The only door is north.

1613.name: Boondocks Courier
description: You are in the offices of Boondocks Courier.  It is little more
than a table and a door leading into what seems to be a back room.  On
the table sits a few packages, apparently ready for transport.

1652.name: A Makeshift Living Chamber
description: You stand in what once was the western tower.  The whole room has been
redone into a living chamber.  On the walls diffrent paintings and pictures
hang.  A bed sits next to the western window, and a large chair and couch
sit in the middle of the room.  A coffee table stands infront of the couch.
You also see a small chest at the end of the bed, another small box, this
one with a latch, against the northern wall.  Infront of the coffee table
and couch, a large box stands, in the front you see dark glass, and you see
knobs and buttons on the front.

1621.name: Northern Moat
description: You are in the middle of the moat, on the north side of the tower.  There is
no place to land here.  Deep throated 'ribbids' come from the water all
around you.

1637.name: Elegant Hall
description: You are in what was once a elegant hall, although everything is moldering now.
The rotted remains of a plush carpet covers the floor, while several moldy
tapestries adorn the each side of the hall.  There are door north and south,
and openings east and west.

1610.name: Minotaur's Room
description: You have entered a secret chamber under the empty room. In this room is
the worn but cared-for gear and trappings of some large humanoid.

1630.name: Art Gallery
description: You are in the ruined remains of an art gallery. Everything appears to
have been stolen long ago, however.  The only exit is north.

1701.name: Main Eastern Road
description: You are on the old Eastern Road.  The crossroads to the east joins ANOTHER
northern route to this road, which continues east.  South of the crossroads is
an old building.  The area around here is lightly timbered.
You see a cross roads and an old building.

1650.name: Turret of the Western Tower
description: You are in the turret of the western tower.  You feel very strange here.
Scattered about this room are a great many coins and valuable articles.
Yet you can't get rid of a feeling of dread!  A mirror-like portal is in the
western wall.
A mirror-like portal glimmers in this wall.

1607.name: House of Pancakes
description: The moment you enter this room, the ceiling descends and crushes you
into a pancake.  Don't you hate it when that happens?

1648.name: Turret of the Eastern Tower
description: You stand in the turret of the eastern tower.  A huge hole has been
made in the roof by some enormous beast, letting the daylight (or moonlight)
in.  There is a hatchway in the floor, and an opening to the west leading out
onto a catwalk.
There is a small opening this way.

1712.name: Centaur's Hut
description: You are inside a smallish hut, the home of a family of Centaurs.  The hut
is sparsely furnished, mostly the trappings of survival.
The opening leads out onto the clearing.

1622.name: Southern Moat
description: You are in the middle of the moat, on the south side of the tower.  There is
no place to land here.  Deep throated 'ribbids' come from the water all
around you.

1707.name: A Strange Clearing
description: This clearing is dark even for a clearing.  Tall, black oaks rise
up on all sides, forming a strange circle where nothing seems to grow.
There is an eerie presence here.

1627.name: Kitchen
description: You have entered what must once have been a kitchen. The rusting remains of
various utensils lie on countertops. There is also an old wash basin and a
pot-belly stove.  There is a door south, and a serving hatch east.

1711.name: West side of the Centaur Clearing
description: You are on the west side of the clearing in the center of the Centaur village.
Huts surround the clearing on all sides, and beyond are towering firs.  The
clearing continues to the east.  To the west is a very large hut.
There is a hut here.
There is a hut here.
There is a hut here.
You see the east side of the clearing.

1629.name: Dining Hall
description: You have entered a fabulous dining hall.  The wrecked remains of a long table
dominate the room. A horrible odor pervades the room, like some foul-smelling
beast has been eating and shitting in here.  There is a serving hatch west and
a door south.

1625.name: Base of the Western Tower
description: You stand in the center of the Western tower's base. Torch brackets occupy
the four corners of this huge room. Above each torch is a lifelike ornate
stone gargoyle.  There are doors north and south, and passages east and west.

1612.name: Airship Parking
description: This is a hard-packed area, within the marsh to the southwest of
the tower.  The dirt is soaked with oil from airships past, and a
large building is butted against the moat to the east.  Stairs lead up
to the entrance, and a crude, multicolored sign hangs above the door
which reads, "{-B{-o{-o{-n{-d{-o{-c{-k{-s {-C{-o{-u{-r{-i{-e{-r{x"

1601.name: a killer frog~
description: The killer frog looks ravenous.
1601.room_name: A killer frog rises up out of the water.

1602.name: the stone gargoyle~
description: As you look, the figure seems to shift and move ...
1602.room_name: A stone gargoyle looms over you.

1603.name: an angry gargoyle~
description: He looks ready to attack!
1603.room_name: An angry gargoyle glares at you.

1604.name: the elite gargoyle~
description: He snarls at you and says LEAVE OR DIE!
1604.room_name: An elite gargoyle guards this room against intrusion.

1605.name: the gargoyle shaman~
description: She says 'I can SEE you! I have been waiting ...'.
1605.room_name: The gargoyle shaman is here, preparing to do battle.

1606.name: a carnivorous plant~
description: The plant looks something like a Venus fly-trap, only MUCH larger.
1606.room_name: Amidst the jungle here, a huge Carnivorous plant reaches out to grab you!

1607.name: a gruesome ogre~
description: It thinks that perhaps you would make a better meal.
1607.room_name: A huge, gruesome ogre is sprawled here, gnawing some strange meat.

1608.name: a shadow~
description: The Shadow is vaguely humanoid. Two glowing pinpoints look at you.
1608.room_name: A dark shadow moves about the room.

1609.name: an evil wight~
description: He glares at you savagely and charges!
1609.room_name: An evil wight lurks in the shadows!

1610.name: A burly minotaur~
description: This powerful creature wonders whether to kill you or not ...
1610.room_name: A burly minotaur watches you solemnly.

1612.name: the savage minotaur~
description: He looks up at you and screams 'SO! Coming to steal my hoard!'
1612.room_name: A bloodthirsty minotaur slowly counts his loot

1613.name: the captain~
description: He looks at you, and a sinister grin slowly spreads on his face ...
1613.room_name: Sitting here in this room is the Minotaur Captain.

1614.name: the black pudding~
description: It is a huge black blob that oozes about the room. Its heading toward YOU!
1614.room_name: A huge black pudding fills the center of the room!!

1615.name: a lesser golem~
description: The golem appears to be made of some kind of clay, enchanted to come to life!
1615.room_name: A lesser Golem stands guarding the entrance.

1616.name: the ancient wyvern~
description: It thunders loudly 'I must protect my Master's wealth!'
1616.room_name: An enormous, ancient wyvern stares down at your tiny form...

1617.name: the spectre~
description: Terror fills your heart as you view this master of the undead.
1617.room_name: A spectre has begun to materialize in front of you!

1702.name: a trapper~
description: The trapper is clad mostly in the fur of various animals he's caught.
1702.room_name: A trapper stands here, bartering his pelts.

1704.name: a hunter~
description: The hunter is rugged and sturdy from his occupation.
1704.room_name: A hunter rests in here, carrying a fresh kill.

1706.name: a ranger~
description: The years of wanderings have left the ranger hardened and strong.
1706.room_name: A grim ranger reclines at a table.

1707.name: a ranger leader~
description: This individual has quite a reputation at the local trading posts!
1707.room_name: A leader of the Rangers is watching you solemnly.

1708.name: the Lord of the Rangers~
1708.room_name: The Lord of the Rangers catches your eye.

1710.name: a centaur~
description: The centaur has the upper torso of a man and lower body of a horse.
1710.room_name: A male centaur wanders about this area.

1711.name: a centaur~
description: The centaur has the upper torso of a woman and lower body of a horse.
1711.room_name: A female centaur wanders about this area.

1712.name: an old centaur~
description: This centaur has lived a full life.
1712.room_name: An old centaur is resting in a corner.

1714.name: an elder centaur~
description: The elders act as counselors and advisors to the chief.
1714.room_name: One of the centaur elders is here, watching you.

1715.name: a centaur guard~
description: He appears to be blocking entrance to the next room.
1715.room_name: A strong centaur is standing guard here.

1716.name: the centaur chief~
description:
He has been the leader of this tribe for many years, and has acquired much
wisdom.
1716.room_name: The chief of the centaur villagers reclines here.

1720.name: a displacer beast~
description: As you watch this strange creature, its position seems to flicker and shift.
1720.room_name: A displacer beast is grazing nearby.

1721.name: a shift foreman~
subroutines:
F for AHMV
F par ABCDEFGHIJK
1721.room_name: A Boondocks Courier shift foreman stands behind the table.
